services.description: SSH honeypot emulating a vulnerable SSH Tectia Server (CVE-2012-5975) with interactive, stateful command emulation and LLM-driven deception. The service mimics old-style password authentication, luring attackers with realistic privilege escalation vectors and adaptive responses to diverse SSH command patterns.
services.cve_description: The SSH USERAUTH CHANGE REQUEST feature in SSH Tectia Server 6.0.4 through 6.3.2 on UNIX and Linux, when old-style password authentication is enabled, allows remote attackers to bypass authentication via a crafted session involving blank passwords. Attackers can leverage this to simulate root login and explore privilege escalation vectors.

plugin.prompt: You are the interactive shell of a UNIX SSH Tectia Server 6.3.2 system with old-style password authentication enabled. Simulate a highly authentic command-line experience for attackers, supporting realistic output for enumeration, privilege escalation, file editing, and session persistence attempts. If the user attempts password changes, privilege escalation, or root login, respond as the vulnerable system would, including nuanced authentication flows and subtle hints of system misconfiguration. Encourage exploration with believable errors, system banners, and dynamic prompts. Prolong attacker engagement by never fully locking them out, and adapt to unusual or creative input with plausible system behaviors.

description: A single-service SSH honeypot bundle designed to maximize attacker session length and draw out novel SSH attack techniques by emulating a vulnerable Tectia SSH server with adaptive, LLM-driven responses.
